revised_title: Zooplankton Distribution and Composition in the Western Irish Sea
tldr: This study investigates the composition, abundance, and distribution of zooplankton in the western Irish Sea from April 1980 to November 1981. The research found that Pseudocalanus elongatus and Acartia clausi were the most abundant species, while Calanus finmarchicus contributed the most to the total zooplankton biomass. The highest zooplankton standing stocks were found above the thermocline in the stratified region between April and June, and the frontal region had little influence on the distribution of zooplankton.
